feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It divides the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month to determine the daily pay rate. Public holidays are automatically deducted from working days to arrive at the actual working days used in the calculation. The feature supports both calendar days and working days leave policies. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the calculated pay deduction is automatically created and reflected on the payroll table.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with options to select calculation bases and salary components.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations, including selection of salary components and calculation methods.
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and unpaid leave deduction calculations
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator by navigating to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection

prerequisites.content: An unpaid leave request must be submitted and approved before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on payroll
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to accurately exclude weekends and public holidays when using working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure the Daily Wage Calculator.
Access to Leave Settings as a Super Admin; ability to add a new leave policy
Super admin role access to payroll configuration settings

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary amount (Basic + Allowance), number of working days in the month, number of calendar days (if using calendar days policy), approved unpaid leave days, and public holiday dates falling in the calculation month

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and choice of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).

Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), selection of calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and configuration of eligible leave types for encashment.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (calendar days, working days, or custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, and deduction reflected on the payroll table
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and determines which salary components and calculation methods apply to leave encashment.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation that applies daily rates to monthly employee payroll
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days to arrive at actual working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount by actual working days, and generate automatic payroll deduction

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service encashment calculations.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (calendar days, working days, or custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and resave the proration settings to apply changes.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Number of actual working days in the month. The number of days can be calendar days (e.g., 30 days) if following the calendar days leave policy or working days (e.g., 22 working days) if following the working days leave policy. Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days to arrive at the actual working days used in the calculation.

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to comply with labor law). The choice of calculation base and salary components directly impacts the final daily wage amounts.

Salary component selection is limited to two options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method selection is limited to three options: Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Configuration applies specifically to leave types eligible for encashment in end-of-service scenarios.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; Super Admins have flexibility to choose from multiple calculation and day type options

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must reject existing transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully identified and deducted from the working days count. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with a 22 working days policy, the daily pay calculation must be based on 20 days (22 minus 2 public holidays), not the standard 22 days.

Calendar days vary by month (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), which affects daily wage calculations. Different calculation methods produce different wage rates, so selection must align with company policy and applicable labor law.

Super admins can view which existing eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by new Daily Wage Calculator configurations, allowing them to assess the impact of changes before applying them.

Multiple options exist for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances; day calculation can be based on calendar days, working days, or custom days depending on organizational policy

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, the Super admin must reject those transactions and then save the changes for salary proration to apply the new settings.

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and integrates with leave management system to process approved unpaid leave requests and employee record systems to access salary information

The Daily Wage Calculator impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It interacts with the company's public holiday calendar and payroll settings to determine accurate daily wage rates.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management systems to customize leave encashment policies that affect end-of-service benefit calculations.
Interacts with the payroll system to apply calculated daily deductions to monthly employee pay; related to leave encashment configuration
Interacts with the Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions; impacts first salary calculations and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary amount derived by dividing total salary (Basic + Allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month, used to determine deductions for unpaid leave. Working days: Business days in a month excluding weekends and public holidays (e.g., 22 days). Calendar days: Total days in a month regardless of weekends or holidays (e.g., 30 days). Actual working days: The final count of working days after deducting public holidays from the total working days in the month.

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month. Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: flexible calculation base set according to company policies, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to align with labor law.

Leave encashment: The conversion of accrued but unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: The final settlement of employee benefits and payments upon termination or separation. Daily Wage Calculator: A configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies based on salary components and calculation methods.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily wage amounts; Leave encashment: Alternative method for handling leave compensation; Basic Only: Calculation method using only base salary; Basic + Allowances: Calculation method including base salary and additional allowances

Daily Wage Calculator (DWC): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary Proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: custom days, calendar days, or working days—the three methods available for determining prorated salary amounts.
